DataElement.preferredName: BF-Diary for Assessing OIC During Bowel Movement How Able to Fully Empty Bowels Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation during this bowel movement, how much did they feel that they were able to fully empty their bowels, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bowel Function Diary for Assessing Opioid-Induced Constipation During this Bowel Movement How Able to Fully Empty Bowels Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to capture relevant patient information regarding opioid-induced constipation in a clinical trial setting. Three modules record information on bowel movements, symptoms experienced, and treatments used to relieve constipation._Occurring in the course of the current bowel movement._A question about how much an individual feels they were able to fully empty their bowels._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Bowel Function Diary for Assessing Opioid-Induced Constipation (BF-Diary)
Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: During this bowel movement, h
ReferenceDocuments.description: During this bowel movement, how much did you feel that you were able to fully empty your bowels?
